{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the trigeminal nerve. The provided documents are unrelated to the trigeminal nerve. Therefore, I will look for information about the trigeminal nerve from general medical knowledge. The trigeminal nerve has three main divisions: ophthalmic, maxillary, and mandibular. Its roots are attached to the pons and the medulla oblongata. It supplies the dura mater of the middle cranial fossa. The trigeminal ganglion contributes to both sensory and motor roots.
